Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2014 05:50PM - edited Mar 18, 2014 06:07PM by curlynski thank you  both...  sheila, i read the link you posted.  yeah, it says in the report that the right breast has a BiRads of 0 because it needs additional imaging.  but what exactly is a "4 mm asymmetry"?  (it was also only seen in the CC view).  i've looked online and i'm getting conflicting information.  what would prevent them from originally getting good clear images?  i got this done at a hospital breast center and they do use 'digital' mammography there.  my previous (and first) mammogram 15 months ago went fine with no 'call back' and i was given a BiRads of 2 for both breasts.  **could having lost 50 lbs since my last and first mammogram make a difference in the way my breasts image?  i have lost weight evenly through my body, including my breasts.  i don't have huge breasts.  my bra size is about a 36 C. (i would say a small C cup size).  i was a 40 C a year ago... also, thank you MsPharoah...  yeah, it's been a hard few years watching my mom pass from metatastic breast cancer.  that has to be part of the reason i am so terrified and feel so confused.  i was so nervous waiting for the results of my first mammogram and this time i wasn't nearly as nervous and i get the "come back for more imaging".   i just seen your response, geeky...and thank you.  it's so hard not have my mom to talk about this with, she was my best friend, and i'm an only child so no sisters or sisters in law's.  my close friends are around my age and haven't even gotten their first mammograms yet or have family history's of BC.  i feel so alone right now...:-(  also, this friday morning at 10:00 i have to consult with a rheumatologist because i've developed Raynaud's in my fingers and toes.  preliminary blood work by my primary doctor was negative for autoimmune but she wants me to follow up with a rheumatologist to find out if my raynaud's is primary (no known cause and not from an underlying disease) or secondary (caused by autoimmine diosorder such as lupus or scleroderma).  i've always had cold hands and feet but this year it's gotten worse, i've developed the color changes when my hands/body get cold.  they sometimes turn a light blue/purple or the tip of a finger will turn white.  again, i'm wondering if i've always had it but never really noticed it (or showed many symptoms) because i was overweight and or obese and had more body fat.  i am much colder now that i am at a normal weight.  so...this friday morning rheumatologist consultation and friday afternoon breast reimaging and possible ultrasound if the mammogram still appears abnormal.  i am a nervous wreck...  i have a long history of anxiety, especially worrying about medical things, especailly test results!!
Posts.Title: I got "called back" for additonal views. I'm very scared! curlynski edwards750

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2014 12:02PM - edited Mar 22, 2014 12:02PM by curlynski UPDATE:  just wanted to update my post for other's who may be going through something similar.  it's frustrating when you read posts and never know what happened to the person.  anyhow, i went for my follow-up test yesterday.  my original mammogram was done in digital 2D.  the spot compression was done in 3D.  after a short wait in the waiting room (seemed a lot longer i was so upset) the nurse came out and said the radiologist just reviewed it and it was a normal lymph node.  she told me to go home and come back in one year.
Posts.Title: I got "called back" for additonal views. I'm very scared! curlynski edwards750

Posts.Content: curlynski wrote: i am 39 years old and had my first mammogram 15 months ago.  it was normal and given a BiRads of 2.  it also stated my density as:  scattered fibroglandular densities.  i also had an MRI 12 months ago because i have BC in my family history and have never had any children (by choice).  it too was normal.  my mom was diagnosed at stage 4 at the age of 66. she hadn't had a mammogram for 20 years and didn't tell anyone about a lump in her breast.  by the time she was diagnosed she was physically week, had an ulcerated breast tumor wound and the cancer had spread to her bones, liver and lungs.  she passed less then 5 months later under hospice care.  i was very close to her and took it all very badly.  she passed away in october of 2012.  my mom's mom also was diagnosed with breast cancer when she was about 69 years old.  she had many other illnesses (diabetes, heart disease, etc) and passed away as a combination of all her health problems.  last tuesday i had my second mammogram (15 months after my first) and i got a letter stating they wanted to do additional views.  i went down to the breast center at my local hospital where i had the mammogram done and got the report it says:  there are scattered fibroglandular densities.   Right Breast:  A 4 mm asymmetry noted within the medial aspect of the right breast, seen only on the CC view, mid depth and approximately 4.0 cm from the nipple.  no suspicious calcifications. Left Breast:  no suspicious masses, calcifications or areas of architectural distortion are identified.  benign appearing calcifications are seen.   ASSESSMENT:  BiRads 0 - incomplete:  need additonal imaging evaluation of the right breast.  BiRads 2 - benign finding in the left breast. Recommendation:  special view mammogram of the right breast.  spot compression CC 3D tomo and LM 3D tomo.  ultrasound if findings persist.  Routine screening mammogram of the left breast in one year.  as an adjunct to mammography, annual MRI can be considered given patient's elevated lifetime risk of breast cancer (20.5%). **  so what exactly am i dealing with here?  should i be concerned?  the breast nurse said something to the affect that it means the right breast looks different then the left and that it is good that it was seen on only one of the two compressions.  she said they often flatten out during the spot compression but if not then i woiuld need an ultrasound.  ugh...is this a common finding at my age?  i am having lots of anxiety about this and they can't get me in for the follow-up until this friday afternoon, 3 days from now!  i also told them at the time of the mammogram that i have lost 50 lbs this past year (due to diet and exercise).  i am now a normal weight (5'6" tall and 145 lbs).   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I got "called back" for additonal views. I'm very scared! curlynski edwards750

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2014 11:21AM curlynski wrote: thanks all...  i just got back from my rheumatology consultation.  he doesn't think i have an autoimmune disorder but ordered a couple more 'marker' tests.  he said i don't have any other physical manifestations other then the raynaud's and didn't seem at all concerned.  my remammogram is at 3:45.  i will update you all and this site for furture people in my boat...
Posts.Title: I got "called back" for additonal views. I'm very scared! curlynski edwards750
